newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia offers $4.5 bln energy package at summit.
newsitem.headline: Colombia offers $4.5 bln energy package at summit.

text.p: Colombia will offer more than $4.5 billion of its energy and mining assets to U.S. companies at the forthcoming bilateral energy summit next week, Mines and Energy Minister Rodrigo Villamizar said Tuesday.

Colombia will use the three-day conference starting next Monday in the Caribbean coast port of Cartagena to present a range of investment opportunities in the oil, gas, coal and electricity generation to 25 private sector U.S. companies.
Representatives of the U.S. Department of Energy are also scheduled to take part in the meeting.

Villamizar did not give specific details of the projects for which he would be looking to attract foreign investment but Colombia has already said it will be looking to sell off more power plants, award more association contracts in the oil sector and grant more coal mining concessions in 1997.
